channel.title: The Virtual Bible Study
channel.itunes:subtitle: Collegevue church of Christ
channel.description: The Virtual Bible Study is a live, internet-only, call-in program presented by the Collegevue church of Christ in Columbia, TN. This online Bible study discussion encourages listener participation with questions and comments. The program airs live on Thursdays at 8:00 PM CT.
channel.itunes:author: Collegevue church of Christ
channel.itunes:keywords: bible study discussion God Word talk radio spirit spiritual guidance bible questions answers

item.title: Snake Handler Dies (May 31, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined the practice of snake handling. Mack Wolford from West Virginia recently died in a Pentecostal worship service after being bit by a rattlesnake. Should we be handling snakes today? What does the Bible say?

item.title: Follow Up To Baptist Preacher Defends Instrumental Music (May 24, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we reviewed arguments used to defend using instrumental music in worship.

item.title: Baptist Preacher Defends Instrumental Music (May 17, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed instrumental music with David Baker from the Lighthouse Baptist Church. David presented his arguments to defend using instrumental music in worship. We denied that instrumental music is authorized by the New Testament.

item.title: 'Insignificant Sins' That Will Send You To Hell (May 10, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at some sins that our society views as not being that big of a deal that the Bible condemns. Are there sins that are overlooked by many that God says He will punish? More importantly, are there any of these sins in our lives?

item.title: Dan Savage Attacks The Bible (May 3, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined an outrageous attack by homosexual activist Dan Savage. He claims we are bullying people when we teach what the Bible says about homosexuality. Is he right? Is the Bible wrong?

item.title: Making Religion Easy (Apr 26, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined the trend to make religion easy. Should we expect religion to be easy and free from sacrifice?

item.title: Questions About Baptism (Apr 19, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we considered various questions about baptism. What things are or are not necessary for baptism? What about young children being baptized? What about re-baptism?

item.title: The Credibility of the Eyewitnesses (Apr 12, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we considered the validity of the eyewitness testimony recorded in the Bible. Can we belive the witnesses? If so, what are the implications?

item.title: Measuring and Maintaining Our Zeal (Apr 5, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed our zeal. God wants us to be zealous or enthusiastic. How do we maintain this zeal?

item.title: Various Listener Questions (Mar 29, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we considered various listener questions. Join us for this important discussion.

item.title: Degrees of Punishment and Reward (Mar 22, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed degrees of punishment and reward. Does the Bible teach degrees of punishment and reward? What about earning one of five crowns?

item.title: Second Coming of Christ (Mar 15, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the second coming of Christ. When will Christ come? Will we have any warnings?

item.title: Our Kids and the Homosexual Agenda (Mar 8, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study Tennessee Senator Stacey Campfield joined us to discuss his proposed legislation that has been called the Don't Say Gay Bill. He is proposing to limit discussion of homosexuality in the classroom. What do the scriptures teach on this important subject?

item.title: The Plan of Salvation (Mar 1, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at what the scriptures teach that we must do in order to be saved. Many false doctrines exist about salvation and we compare some of these with what the scriptures teach in this important discussion.

item.title: Training Up a Child (Feb 23, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed parenting children. What principles from the scriputres help parents with this enormous task?

item.title: Miscellaneous Listener Questions (Feb 16, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we studied various listener questions. We discussed Christian being in the military, labor unions, along with other issues. Join us for this important discussion.

item.title: Dealing with Depression (Feb 9, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed depression. What principles from the Bible help us to deal with and overcome depression? Is is ok to take medication for depression?

item.title: Parenting Teenagers (Feb 2, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed raising teenagers. We specifically looked at guidelines for teenagers dating. Join us for this important study.

item.title: Viral Video_Why I Hate Religion (Jan 26, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at the viral video that claims it is possible to Love Jesus and Hate Religion. Is this possible?

item.title: Are Those in Denominations Lost? Part 2 (Jan 19, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we continued our examination of denominations. We again asked if those in denominations are lost. Join us for this important follow-up discussion.

item.title: Are Those in Denominations Lost? Part 1 (Jan 12, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we asked if those in denominations are lost. Join us for this important discussion.

item.title: Can You Prove the Bible is Inspired? (Jan 05, 2012)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at reasons why we believe the Bible is inspired. What are reasons that we can have faith that the Bible is inspired?

item.title: Resolutions (Dec 29, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed resolutions. Are resolutions good? What are some resolutions we should make?

item.title: Happier Homes (Dec 22, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at scriptural principles that will lead to happier homes.

item.title: Worship Attire (Dec 15, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we considered dressing for worship. Are there any guidelines that we can use to determine what we should wear to a worship assembly?

item.title: Questions About Marriage (Dec 08, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed various questions about marriage, divorce, and remarriage. Please join us for this important discussion.

item.title: Does the Bible Teach Eternal Security (Dec 01, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined the doctrine of once saved always saved. Can a Christian live in such a way to lose his or her salvation?

item.title: Christians and Politics (Nov 24, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed if Christians can vote, can hold political office, and just how involved Christians should be in the political process.

item.title: Various Listener Questions (Nov 17, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed various listener questions. Join us for a discussion of these interesting questions.

item.title: Is One Faith As Good As Another (Nov 10, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the idea that one faith is as good as another. Is this so? Does it matter what we believe?

item.title: Capital Punishment (Nov 03, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed capital punishment. What does the Bible say about capital punishment? Should we practice capital punishment today?

item.title: Near Death Experiences (Oct 27, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined near-death experiences. Are near-death experiences real? What does the Bible say?

item.title: Ready to Give an Answer (Oct 20, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at various questions that people ask about the church of Christ and answered those questions.

item.title: Is Mormonism a Cult? (Oct 13, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we considered Mormonism and asked if it is a cult. What are the characteristics of a cult? Join us as we ask these important questions.

item.title: Prosperity and Adversity (Oct 6, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed prosperity and adversity. How can we be faithful to God in both good times and bad?

item.title: Responsibilities Toward the Local Church (Sep 29, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed membership in a local church. Is membership required and, if so, what responsibilities does a member have to the congregation?

item.title: Do Circumstances Determine Right and Wrong? (Sep 22, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed situation ethics. Pat Robertson recently made some intersting comments that show the error of situation ethics. Join us for this important discussion.

item.title: The Reliability of the Bible (Sep 15, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the reliability of the Bible. Can the Bible be trusted? If so, why?

item.title: Conflict Resolution in Marriage (Sep 8, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined scriptural principles to apply in resolving marriage conflicts. How do we resolve conflicts in our marriage when they arise?

item.title: Demons and Angels (Sep 1, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at what the scriptures teach about demons and angels. What does the Bible reveal about these beings?

item.title: Why Study Evidences? (Aug 25, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined evidences. What evidences do we have for our faith and why should we study evidences?

item.title: Various Listener Questions (Aug 18, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we answered various listeners' questions. What about tattos? What about an elder who smokes? These are just a few of the questions we considered on this program.

item.title: What Makes a Good Sermon? (Aug 11, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at sermons and considered what makes a good sermon. What does a sermon need with respect to God, the audience, visual aids, etc. to be effective?

item.title: The Sinner's Prayer (Aug 4, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Frank Webb about the sinner's prayer. He beileves we must say a prayer to be saved. What does the Bible teach?

item.title: NASCAR Preacher's Prayer (July 28, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Joe Nelms about the prayer he delivered at the start of a recent NASCAR race. His prayer has been labeled irreverent and we discussed this as well as asked what guidelines we should use in approaching God.

item.title: Six Steps to a Broken Home (July 21, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined progressive steps that lead to a failed marriage. What characteristics and actions in our lives can lead to divorce?

item.title: Interview with State Senator Regarding Persecution (July 14, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed a new state law with Senator Bill Ketron. His anti-bullying law has some concerned that it could infringe on religious free speech.

item.title: Courts of Men vs. Courts of God (July 7, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we considered the problems inherent in the human court system and contrasted human courts with the courts of God.

item.title: False Views About Jesus (June 30, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined several false views of Jesus. What are these views and how do we know they are false?

item.title: The Use of Tobacco (June 23, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the use of tobacco. What principles from the Scriptures can we use to determine wheather the use of tobacco is acceptable for a Christian?

item.title: Disturbing Trends in the Church (June 16, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at disturbing trends in the church. What are some trends underway that are leading away from the scriptures and God?

item.title: Nine Listener Questions (June 09, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we answered various listeners' questions. We discussed birthdays, cremations, marriage, Osama Bin Laden, and more! Be sure to listen to this important discusssion!

item.title: Church Attacked for Stance on Homosexuality (June 02, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Larry Wright of the Garden City church of Christ about the recent persecution they have received over their teaching that homosexuality is a sin. Be sure to listen to this important discussion.

item.title: The Failed May 21st Prophecy (May 26, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the failed May 21st prophecy. What do we know about the end of the world? What should be our attitude toward the second coming of Christ?

item.title: Is Membership in a Church Necesary? (May 19, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed church membership. Is it necessary to be a member of a local church and, if so, what are the benefits of membership?

item.title: Marriage and Divorce (May 12, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined what the scriptures teach about divorce and remarriage. Is divorce allowed? If so, under what circumstances?

item.title: One Word Answers to Calvinism (May 05, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at one word answers to the doctrines fo Calvinism.

item.title: Why Do Some Fall Away? (Apr 28, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed why some lose their faith and fall away? Be sure to listen to this important discussion to learn why anyone might potentially fall away.

item.title: Should We Observe Easter? (Apr 21, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Easter. Where does the Easter holiday originate and should we observe the holiday?

item.title: Methodist Professor Says Churches of Christ are Right (Apr 14, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Ted Campbell, a professor at Southern Methodist University, about a recent blog post that he made declaring that the churches of Christ are correct on certain doctrinal matters. What are these doctrinal matters and does it matter what we believe and practice?

item.title: Will a Loving God Send People to Hell (Apr 07, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Rob Bell's new book in which he challenges the concept of hell. Does God's nature preclude him from sending anyone to hell? Does hell even exist?

item.title: How Are You Going to Be Different? (Mar 31, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the morals of our society and noticed how far they are from God's standards. As a result, we must make effort to be different from the world.

item.title: The Church Is the People (Mar 24, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the fact the the church is the people and not the building. This has implications on how we view the church and how we act toward it.

item.title: What is the Least I can Believe and Still Be a Christian (Mar 17, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Martin Thielen about his new book in which he asks what is the least one can believe and still be a Christian. Be sure to listen to this interesting discussion.

item.title: Authority for the Church Building and Its Use (Mar 10, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the church building. Does the church have authority for a church building, and if so, how should it be used?

item.title: Open Forum (Mar 03, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we answered various questions presented by our listeners. Be sure to listen to this important discussion!

item.title: What Baptism Does Not Do (Feb 24, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed what baptism does not do. What do the scriptures teach about baptism?

item.title: Hijacked Bible Doctrines (Feb 17, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed hijacked Bible doctrines. We looked at doctrines that false teachers have perverted and corrupted.

item.title: Confessing Our Sins (Feb 10, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed confessing our sins. Is confession required? If so, how should we confess our sins?

item.title: Conflict Resolution (Feb 03, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed how we should handle conflicts in the church. What principles from the Bible apply when a conflict arises?

item.title: What We KNOW About The End of The World (Jan 27, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed what the Bible teaches about tthe end of the world. Can we know when the end of the world will be? Are there signs of the end of the world?

item.title: Will Judgment Day Be May 21st? (Jan 13, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed several preachers who believe the end of the world is coming soon based upon what they think the Bible teaches. Are they correct? Can we know when the end of the world will be?

item.title: A Pentecostal Preacher Discusses Oneness Doctrine (Jan 13, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Rick Craft, a Pentecostal preacher, who holds the oneness view of the Godhead. We discussed his view and compared it to what the scriptures teach about the Godhead.

item.title: A Preacher Attempts to Defend Drinking (Jan 6, 2011)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Jon McLemore of The Street Corner Symphony. Jon and his group were recent runners up on The Sing Off which aired on NBC. Jon said on the program that he enjoys drinking beer. We discussed this with Jon on the program.

item.title: Reconsidering Our Giving (Dec 30, 2010)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed our giving. What principles should we use to determine our giving? Are we giving enough?

item.title: Questions That The Bible Does Not Answer(Dec 23, 2010)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Question that the Bible does not answer. What do we know about question like this are we missing infromation that we need.

item.title: Hindrances to Baptism(Dec 16, 2010)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed what might hinder someone from being baptized and discussed what the scriptures teach about baptism.

item.title: Offering Criticism(Dec 09, 2010)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discuss criticism. When is criticism proper and how we should receive and respond to criticism?

item.title: Self-Control at Year's End (Dec 02, 2010)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed self-control around the holiday season. How should we practice self-control in the areas of spending, worldliness, and eating?

item.title: Blessing the Animals and Does Silence Authorize? (Nov 25, 2010)
item.description: On this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discuss the practice of some denominations to have special services to bless the animals. This is based on the presumption that, even though the Bible never addresses this, we are free to act where the Bible is silent. Study this important subject with us.

item.title: Organization and Work of the Church (Nov 18, 2010)
item.description: This edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed common errors in the religious world concering the church organization.

item.title: Various Listener Questions (Nov 11, 2010)
item.description: This edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed various questions submitted by our listeners. Join us for this important discussion.

item.title: Priorities for the Local Church (Nov 04, 2010)
item.description: This edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed priorities for the local church. What should the church place emphasis on? Does the Bible define priorities for the local church?

item.title: Anne Rice Quits Christianity (Oct 28, 2010)
item.description: This edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed why Ann Rice no longer wants to be a Christian.

item.title: You Might Think You Can Earn Your Salvation If... (Oct 21, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we discussed earning our salvation. The scriptures teach that we can not earn or merit our salvation, but certain attitudes we have may indicate that we are guilty of thinking we can earn our salvation.

item.title: The Problem of Human Suffering (Oct 07, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we discussed human suffering. All humans suffer. Is this suffering caused by God or Satan? Can good come from the suffering?

item.title: Helping a Christian in Doubt (Sep 30, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we answered questions that a listener submitted that were causing him some doubt and concern. Please listen to this important discussion as we go to the scriptures to strengthen our faith.

item.title: Can Miracles be Naturally Explained (Sep 23, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we discussed miracles. We asked if miracles could be naturally explained.

item.title: Dumb Things Christians Do (Sep 16, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we discussed the dumb things Christians do and how we can avoid those mistakes.

item.title: Koran Burning/Religious Tolerance (Sep 09, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we discussed the preacher who plans to burn the Koran. How should we respond to those who disagree with us?

item.title: The 70 AD Doctrine/Realized Eschatology (Sep 02, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we examined the 70 AD doctrine which is also known as Realized Eschatology. Has the final coming of Christ already occurred?

item.title: Man Sues Bible Publisher (Aug 26, 2010)
item.description: Man Sues Bible Publisher saying homosexuality was not condemned in the orginal bible.

item.title: Spiritual School Supplies (Aug 19, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed what students need in order to be pleasing to God. What are the spiritual school supplies every student should have as they go back to school?

item.title: Church Mission Statements (Aug 12, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed chruch mission statements. Should the church have a mission statement? What are some dangers of mission statements? What is the mission of the church?

item.title: Listener Questions (Aug 5, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we answer questions that were provide from you the viewer!

item.title: Five Years of The Virtual Bible Study (Jul 29, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we reviewed the past five years of the Virtual Bible Study. We looked that the ten most downloaded programs and discussed them in review.

item.title: Review of The Interview with The Presbyterian Church (Jul 22, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we reviewed our interview with the Presbyterian preacher in which he defended accepting homosexuals in positions of leadership in the Presbyterian church.

item.title: Homosexuality and The Presbyterian Church (Jul 15, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the recent decision by the Presbyterian church to allow practicing homosexuals to serve in positions of leadership. We talked with a Presbyterian minister about his understanding of what the scriptures teach about homosexuality.

item.title: Gossip (Jul 08, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed gossip. What is gossip and how do we avoid it?

item.title: Single Christians (Jul 01, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed living as a single Christian. Why would someone live as a single person and what are the benefits and challenges facing a single person?

item.title: Selecting A Mate (Jun 24, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed selecting a spouse. The importance of selecting a life long spouse!

item.title: Spiritual Warfare (Jun 17, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we spiritual warfare. We are in a spiritual war for our souls! How can we be victorious?

item.title: Biblical Financial Principles (Jun 10, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Biblical financial principles. What does the Bible teach us about our finances? Be sure to listen to this study!

item.title: Pattern Theology (Jun 3, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed pattern theology. Should we be following the patterns of the New Testament or can we serve God anyway that we please.

item.title: Eternal Security (May 27, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the doctrine of Once Saved, Always Saved. What does the Bible teach about this doctrine?

item.title: Open Forum (May 20, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we had an open forum. Be sure to listen to this episode as we answered various questions submitted by our listeners.

item.title: Religious Unity (May 13, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the important subject of religious unity. How can we achieve it? What attitudes must we possess to make unity possible?

item.title: The Role of Women (May 6, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the role of women. What does the Bible teach concerning the woman's role in the home and church?

item.title: Noah's Ark (April 29, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Noah's Ark. Recent news reports say that Noah's Ark has been discovered. If so, what are the impacts of such a discovery?

item.title: Dancing and the Prom (April 22, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed dancing and the Prom. What does the Bible say about dancing? Should a Christian attend the prom?

item.title: The Tea Party Movement and Our Relationship to the Government (April 15, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed our relationship to the government. Can we rebel against the government? Can we revolt if the government becomes oppressive or wicked? Be sure to listen to this important study!

item.title: The Fear of God (April 08, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the fear of God. Should we fear God? How will the fear of God demonstrate itself in our lives?

item.title: Forbidden Speech (April 01, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed forbidden speech. What are some things that the Bible tells us to avoid in our speech?

item.title: Congregational Singing (March 25, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed congregational singing. Does the Bible command congregational singing? What can we do to improve our congregational singing?

item.title: Bible Translations (March 18, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we discussed the reliability of our Bibles, and we looked at several English translations. Some are good, but some are bad. Which ones should we be using?

item.title: Evolution (March 11, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we discussed evolution? Is the theory accurate? Does it contrdict science?

item.title: The Age of the Earth (March 4, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we talked with an Astronomy teacher about what he believes about the age of the earth. Is the earth really Billions of years old? What does the Bible teach?

item.title: Can You Be Religious without a Church? and Using Martial Arts to Convert People? (February 25, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study, we talked with a preacher who is using Martial Arts to attract people to his church. Is this acceptable to God? Also, we discussed whether we need to be a part of a church to be pleasing to God.

item.title: What About Those Who Never Hear the Gospel? (February 18, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed asked what would be the eternal destiny of those who never hear the gospel. What does the Bible teach about this important question?

item.title: The Only Ones Going To Heaven? (February 11, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed whether we should be more inclusive. Should we accept anyone who believes in Jesus regardless of what they practice? Who will go to heaven anyway?

item.title: Parents of the Bible (February 4, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed parents of the Bible. Parents today face enormous challenges. Who are some examples from the Bible that they can look to for an example?

item.title: Young People of the Bible (January 28, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed young people of the Bible. Young people today face enormous challenges as they try to live for God. Who are some examples from the Bible that they can look to for an example?

item.title: Brotherly Love (January 21, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed brotherly love. How will brotherly love manifest itself in our lives?

item.title: The Movies(January 14, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed movies. What guidelines should we use in determining what kind of movies we view?

item.title: Alleged Contradictions in the Resurrection Accounts(January 07, 2010)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed Dan Barker's essay in which he claims to have discovered contradictions in the Resurrection accounts. Do these accounts contradict or are their explainations?

item.title: Alleged Bible Contradictions (December 31, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed how we can deal with alleged contradictions in the Bible.

item.title: Listeners' Questions (December 24, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed various questions submitted by our listeners.

item.title: The Home Church Movement (December 17, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed the house church movement. Is it wrong for a church to meet anywhere other than a home? Should the size of churches be kept to a minimum?

item.title: Some Questions About God (December 10, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed some characteristics of God that we need to understand in order to be pleasing to Him.

item.title: Seven Things a Loving God Hates (December 03, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed seven things that the scriptures say that God hates.

item.title: COMPLAINING! (November 26, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed something that often hinders us from being thankful: complaining.

item.title: 2012: End of the World? (November 19, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed the claim that the world will end in 2012. What does the Bible say about the end of the world and Christ's return?

item.title: What Was Jesus Really Like? (November 12, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed what Jesus was really like. Was Jesus like so many in the religious world today think he was?

item.title: Life After Death (November 5, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed life after death. What does the Bible teach about heaven and hell?

item.title: Listeners' Questions (October 29, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We answered questions submitted by listeners from around the world. Be sure to listen to this program as we discuss various important topics.

item.title: Unpopular Sayings of Jesus (October 22, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed unpopular sayings of Jesus. What are some of the sayings of Christ that are difficult to accept and, as a result, are unpopular?

item.title: Catholicism Reviewed (October 15, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed Catholicism and compared the Catholic Church to the Bible.

item.title: An Interview with a Catholic (October 8, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We inteviewed a Catholic who is a former member of the church of Christ. Find out why he believes that the Catholic church is the true church of the scriptures.

item.title: Prayer (October 1, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We discussed prayer. What are some principles that the scriptures teach about prayer? How can we make our prayers more effective?

item.title: Walking With Jesus (September 24, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study We talked about the need to step out of our comfort zones and overcome our fears in order to effectively serve the Master.

item.title: Parenting (September 17, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed parenting. What are some Biblical principles on raising children?

item.title: Listener's Questions (September 10, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of the Virtual Bible Study we discussed questions that our listener's have submitted.

item.title: Questions for a Baptist (September 3, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of the Virtual Bible Study we discussed questions that we would like for a Baptist to answer from the scriptures.

item.title: Questions the "Church of Christ Cannot Answer" (August 27, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of the Virtual Bible Study we discussed questions that one Baptist preacher says a Church of Christ preacher cannot answer. Be sure to listen to this important discussion!

item.title: Is the Old Testament Still Binding Today? (August 20, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of the Virtual Bible Study we discussed the Old Testament with a Messianic Jew. What does the Bible say about the Old Testament? Is it still binding today?

item.title: What to Look for in a Church (August 13, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of the Virtual Bible Study we considered what we should be looking for when we look for a church. What are some characteristics that are important in a church?

item.title: Various Questions (August 06, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of the Virtual Bible Study we answered various questions that were submitted from our listeners.

item.title: Review of our Interview with a Calvinist (July 30, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we reviewed our interview with a Calvinist and compared Calvinism with the Bible.

item.title: An Interview with a Calvinist (July 23, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed a Calvinist. What do Calvinists believe and how do their beliefs compare to what the Bible teaches?

item.title: Social Media (July 16, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed social media. What are some dangers to our spirituality that social media presents.

item.title: Role Models (July 09, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed role models. Who should we be looking to for role models and how can we be effective role models and influences?

item.title: How We Got the New Testament (July 02, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed how we got the New Testament and how we can be confident that we have a valid copy of the New Testament today. We also discussed how we can determine if alleged contradictions are actually valid contradictions.

item.title: Marriage is Honorable (June 25, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed marriage. Our society does not honor marriage. What does the Bible teach about marriage?

item.title: Proof of the Resurrection (June 18, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed proofs of the resurrection. What are some proofs of Christ's resurrection and what does the resurrection mean to our faith?

item.title: The Bible Class Arrangement (June 11, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Bible classes. Do the scriptures authorize Bible classes? How can we have profitable Bible classes?

item.title: Thought Control (June 4, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the need to control our thoughts. How can we considered ways to make sure we are thinking about the correct things. We made the application of controlling our thoughts to the problem of pornography.

item.title: The Old Testament and Instrumental Music (May 28, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the Old Testament and asked if the Old Testament is still binding today or can be used to justify our religious practices. We also considered the question of whether or not instrumental music is authorized in our worship today.

item.title: The Missing Link? (May 21, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virutal Bible Study we discussed the recent find that people are claiming to be the "missing link". We discussed evolution and the problems with the theory.

item.title: Hate Speech? (May 14, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virutal Bible Study we discussed H.R. 1913 and the legislation designed to stop "hate speech". We then considered if preaching what the Bible teaches is actually "hate speech".

item.title: Various Topics (May 07, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virutal Bible Study we discussed various questions submitted from our listeners. Be sure to listen to this important discussion.

item.title: Swine Flu (April 30, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virutal Bible Study we discussed Swine Flu. What does human suffering tell us about God? How should we view things like the Swine Flu?

item.title: Religious Tolerance (April 23, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virutal Bible Study we considered religious tolerance. Should we tolerate those in religious error? What does the Bible teach about tolerance?

item.title: The Deity of Jesus (April 16, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virutal Bible Study, we looked at proof that Jesus is the son of God. What does the deity of Christ demand of us?

item.title: Is America a Christian Nation? (April 9, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virutal Bible Study, we asked if America is a Christian nation. What does it mean to be Christian? How can we know if we are Christians?

item.title: The Christian and His Work (April 2, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we considered our attitude and responsibility toward our work. Should we be working? What should be our attitude toward our work.

item.title: What Is Providence? (March 26, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at God's Providence. What is it? What examples do we find in the Bible? How does it work?

item.title: Decision Making for Christians (March 19, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of the Virtual Bible Study we looked at considerations we should remember when making decisions. How can we be sure that God approves of our decsions?

item.title: Personal Evangelism (March 12, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of the Virtual Bible Study, we personal evangelism. We considered excuses people make for not evangelizing and tips for being more effective evangelism.

item.title: Responding to a Viewer About Baptism (March 5, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we responded to a viewer who had seen one of our YouTube videos about baptism. His email message provided a good opportunity to discuss many of the differences that exist in the religious world on the important subject of baptism.

item.title: Religious Holidays (Febuary 26, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed religious holidays. Should we be observing religious holidays? What does the Bible say?

item.title: The Indwelling of the Holy Spirit (Febuary 19, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the indwelling of the Holy Spirit. How does the Holy Spirit dwell in us? What does this mean?

item.title: The Sponsoring church Arrangement (Febuary 12, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the sponsoring church arrangement. Do you know what the sponsoring church arrangement is? Is it scriptural? Find out in this edition of The Virtual Bible Study!

item.title: Two Kinds of Abortion (Febuary 05, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed two types of abortion. We considered physical abortion and noted what the Bible teaches that would condemn physical abortion. But, we also considered "spiritual abortion" in which parents do nothing to insure that their children grow spiritually. Be sure to listen to this important discussion!

item.title: Preachers (January 29, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed preachers and their works. We considered what the Bible teaches about the work of the preacher. We also considered some of the abuses of a preacher.

item.title: 10 Questions About Baptism (January 22, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we answered questions about baptism. Is baptism required for salvation? What is the purpose of salvation?

item.title: Covetousness and Consumer Credit (January 15, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed covetousness as it relates to the acquisition of debt. What should be our attitude toward our possessions? How should Christians view debt?

item.title: Urgency of Obedience (January 8, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the urgency of being obedient to God. We discussed the benefits being obedient to God and the foolishness of waiting until our deathbed to submit to God.

item.title: Maintaining Moral Purity (January 1, 2009)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed maintaining moral purity. In the wicked world that we live in, we must give diligence to maintain purity as the pure in heart will be the ones who see God.

item.title: Various Topics (December 25, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed various Bible subjects that are on the minds of people today. We discussed abortion, homosexuality, attending the prom, and denominationalism. Be sure to listen to the discussion of these important topics.

item.title: The Salvation Army(December 18, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we studied about the Salvation Army. We noted it's origin, organization, and doctrines. We dealt with the question as to whether or not we could financially support the Salvation Army. Please join us for this important discussion!

item.title: Establishing Bible Authority-Part 2(December 11, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we continued the discussion of the need for Bible Authority. We noted that if we do not have Bible authority for all that we do we can not demand Bible authority for anything that we do. Please join us as we continue this important discussion!

item.title: Establishing Bible Authority-Part 1(December 4, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the need for Bible Authority. We discussed the fact that not demanding Biblical authority for all that we do has led to the religious chaos that exists in the world today. Please join us for this important discussion!

item.title: Biblical Principles for Tough Economic Times(November 27, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Biblical principles for tough economic times. We reviewed some of the mistakes that Christians might make when facing financial trials, and we listed some important concepts that we all need to remember.

item.title: If I Was Satan...(November 20, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we asked the question "If you were Satan and wanted to destroy the church, what would you do?" We discussed tactics that Satan uses in an effort to destroy the church and its influence.

item.title: Satan & The AntiChrist(November 13, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Satan, his origin, is he a fallen angel?, did God create him evil, and we also discussed the current speculations about the AntiChrist, is he identifable, is he in the world today?

item.title: Our Duty to the New President(November 06, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the Christian's obligation to the government and specifically the new President. What should be the Christian's attitude and response to the President?

item.title: What Would Be Your Ideal Church?(October 30, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed desirable characteristics in a church. What are some things that would be present in your ideal church?

item.title: Does it Matter How We Worship?(October 23, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed worship. Does it matter how we worship? What about "Contemporary Worship"?

item.title: Are the Jews God's Chosen People?(October 16, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Premillenialism. Will Christ return to establish a physical kingdom on earth and reign for 1000 years? Are the physical Jews still God's chosen people?

item.title: What is God Really Like?(October 9, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the nature of God. There are many misconceptions about God in the world today. If we fail to understand God, we won't serve him as we should.

item.title: Can You Vote for Sarah Palin-Part 2(October 2, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we continued our discussion of voting for Sarah Palin for Vice President. We considered I timothy 2 in more detail in answering the question of a woman holding a position of authority.

item.title: Can You Vote for Sarah Palin (September 25, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed voting for Sarah Palin for Vice President. Should a woman hold the position of Vice President? What does the Bible say?

item.title: Dangers We Face (September 18, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the dangers we face as Christians today. What are the dangers we face and how can we overcome them?

item.title: The Parent/Child Relationship (September 11, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the parent/child relationship. The family is under attack in America today. We looked to God's Word for how the family should operate. What should children expect of parents? What should parents expect of children?

item.title: Young People, The Church, and Carnal Attractions (September 04, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the carnal means that churches today are using to attract people to attend their services. Gymnasiums, playgrounds, entertainment, free-gas giveaways, and other attractions are employed to attract people today. Are these acceptable means to employ in attracting people to Christ?

item.title: God's Role for Women (August 28, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed God's role for women. What roles does God expect for women to assume and what guidelines should we be following in those roles?

item.title: God's Role for Men (August 21, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed God's role for men. What roles does God expect for men to assume and what guidelines should we be following in those roles?

item.title: Essentials for Scriptural Baptism (August 14, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed baptism. We believe baptism is required for salvation and we discussed essential components of that baptism. Be sure to listen to this important study.

item.title: Dealing with Controversy No. 2 (August 7, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we continued a discussion on dealing with controversy in the church. In this program we discussed positive things that we should consider to when dealing with controversy.

item.title: Dealing with Controversy No. 1 (July 31, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed dealing with controversy in the church. There will be controversy. The question is how should we deal with it. This is the first of a two part discussion in which we discussed the wrong ways to deal with controversy.

item.title: How to Use the Old Testament (July 24, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the Old Testament and its relevance to us today. Should we study the Old Testament? What are some suggestions for doing so?

item.title: Can We Be Sure of Our Salvation? (July 17, 2008)
item.description: *****NOTE: We experienced technical dificulties during this program. Sound quality is poor.*****In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed our salvation. How can we have confidence that we can have salvation?

item.title: Preachers and Religious Titles (July 10, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed preachers and the use of religious titles. Should we be assuming religious titles? What about paying preachers to preach? We examined these questions in this edition of The Virtual Bible Study.

item.title: God's Answer to Prayer (July 3, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the conditions we must meet for our prayers to be acceptable to God, and how God answers our prayers. Be sure to listen to this important discussion!

item.title: Questions from the Book of Acts (June 26, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the book of Acts and looked at lessons we can learn from the book. Be sure to listen to this important discussion!

item.title: Homosexuality and Homosexual Marriage (June 19, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed homosexuality and homosexual marriage. Homosexual marriage is in the news this week as California legalized homosexual marriage. What does the Bible say about this important subject?

item.title: What Would Upset Jesus Most?? (June 12, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed what would potentially upset Jesus the most if he were on the earth today. What sins in the world today would bother Jesus the most?

item.title: Can We Learn from Other Religions? (June 5, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Perry Cotham who authored the book "One World, Many Nations". He suggests we should learn from those of other religions. We examined this claim.

item.title: What Will Heaven Be Like? (May 29, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the characteristics of Heaven. We discussed some misunderstandings as well as the true characteristics that God reveals to us about Heaven.

item.title: What Are You Looking For in a Church? (May 22, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed things we should be looking for in a church. We looked at things many look for in a church that are unimportant or unscriptural as well things that should be important.

item.title: Answering an Objector (May 15, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed some objections that a listener, Erik, posed about what we believe. We compared Erik's objections with what the Bible teaches.

item.title: Top 10 Most Hated Bible Doctrines (May 8, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Biblical doctrines that people hate. We looked at teachings that, while true from the Scriptures, are difficult to accept and are, as a result, hated by many.

item.title: The Christian and Personal Finance (May 1, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed our material blessings. How should we be using the material blessings that God has given us? What about declaring bankruptcy? Is it a sin to declare bankruptcy?

item.title: Our Example (April 24, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed our example. What characteristics of our lives show others that we are following Christ? Do our lives reflect Christ and cause others to want to follow Him?

item.title: Modesty (April 17, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed nakedness and modesty. Does the Bible draw any lines in the clothes that we wear? Are the Biblical standards of dress dependent on our situation or location?

item.title: Gambling (April 10, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed gambling. Does the Bible teach principles that determine if gambling is right or wrong? What about investing in the stock market, buying raffle tickets, or accepting state scholarships that are funded by gambling? We discussed these questions in this study.

item.title: Elders (April 3, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed elders. What are the characteristics that the Bible sets forth those who are to serve in the capacity of an elder? Be sure to listen to this important study.

item.title: Loving Family More Than God (March 27, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed a recent survey that showed that 7 in 10 Americans place their relationship with a family member over their relationship with God. We examined our lives and asked if we might be placing our family above God as well.

item.title: Serve God-Stop Global Warming? (March 20, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Matthew Sleeth who is the author of "Serve God-Save the Planet". He believes the serving God will prevent Global Warming. The discussion with Matthew led to a discussion of the Sabbath.

item.title: Reaching the Lost (March 13, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed how to reach the lost? How can we be effective in sharing the Gospel with our neighbors?

item.title: Miracles? (March 6, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we studied miracles? Why were there miracles in Bible times? Are there still miracles in the world today?

item.title: Why Can't I Convert My Neighbor? (February 28, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we ask why the Gospel doesn't seem to be spreading in the world around us. We looked at factors among those in the world that may be hindering the Gospel, and we looked at characteristics in our lives that may be keeping us from spreading the Gospel like we should.

item.title: Atheism Debate (February 21, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Dan Barker who is an atheist activist. He hosts a radio program on Air America. We discussed arguments for the existence of God.

item.title: Priorities (February 14, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined our lives and asked what the characteristics of our lives said about our priorities. We asked if what we DO lines up with what we SAY about our priorities.

item.title: Seeking a Mate (February 7, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we considered what we should look for in a mate? What qualities are important in our mate? What does the Bible say? If you're single, you'll want to listen to this important discussion!

item.title: Prayer and Praying to Jesus (January 31, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed prayer and praying to Jesus. How can we improve our prayer? Is it appropriate to pray to Jesus? What does the Bible instruct?

item.title: Giving (January 24, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed our giving to the Lord. What kind of giving does God require? What guidelines should we use in our giving?

item.title: Does Religion Hurt Society? (January 17, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the common idea that religion is detrimental to society. Does religion harm society? What about all of the atrocities that people have committed in the name of religion?

item.title: Absolute Truth (January 10, 2008)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed absolute truth. Does absolute truth exist? How do we determine absolute truth if it does exist? Do the absolute truths of God's word change over time based upon the societal norms?

item.title: Spiritual Keys for the New Year (January 3, 2008)
item.description: In the first edition of The Virtual Bible Study for 2008 we discussed spiritual keys to having a sucessful new year. What should we be doing spiritually that will ensure that 2008 is a success?

item.title: Authority; Treasury and Church Buildings (December 27, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we asked if church treasuries and church buildings are approved by the scriptures.

item.title: Mormonism and Politics (December 20, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Mormonism. What do Mormons believe? How does this compare to what the Bible teaches?

item.title: Biblical Principals for Parenting (December 13, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed what the Bible says about parenting children. We interviewed Jordan Riak from Parents and Teachers Against Violence in Education who strongly believes that spanking children is wrong. We considered what he said with respect to what the Bible says about corporal punishment.

item.title: God's Providence (December 06, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the providence of God. Is God active in the world today? Is He active in our lives? We asked these questions during this broadcast.

item.title: The Dangers of Television (November 29, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the immorality of television and the dangers it poses to us spiritually. Join us for this important study as we examine an avenue of temptation that is a danger to us all.

item.title: Take Heed and Beware of Covetousness (November 22, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed our relationship to our physical possessions. The Bible repeatedly tells us to be careful about our attitude toward riches. We discussed these warnings on this program.

item.title: By This Shall All Men Know Ye Are My Disciples (November 15, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed love for our brethren. Jesus taught us that we would show the world that we are His disciples by the way that we love one another. We discussed how we can show our love for our brethren in this edition of the Virtual Bible Study.

item.title: Open Forum (November 08, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we had an open forum. Join us for this discussion of various questions submitted by our listeners.

item.title: Excuses (November 01, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed excuses. We took our listeners feedback about excuses they have heard and compared them with what the Bible teaches.

item.title: Abortion (October 25, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed abortion. What does the Bible say? Are abortions pleasing to God?

item.title: Are There Christians in All Denominations (October 18, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we asked the question "Are there Christians in all denominations?" Join us for this important discussion.

item.title: Interview with a Former Episcopal Minister (October 11, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed Jonathan Hartzer, a former Episcopal minister. We discussed the stand that he and members of the congregation he is associated with took in oposition to the Episcopal Church's acceptance of homosexuality. We also discussed apostacy in general and how we can prevent it.

item.title: How to Establish Bible Authority (October 4, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed authority. Do we need to have authority for everything we do religiously or can we do what ever we thing is right? And, if we need authority from the Bible for everything we do, how do we establish that authority?

item.title: Racism (September 27, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed worship. Do we have any patterns that we must follow in worship? Or, can we worship any way that makes us happy?

item.title: Racism (September 20, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed what the Bible says about racism. Should we be prejudiced towards those of other races? What does the Bible say?

item.title: The Health and Wealth Doctrine (September 13, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the "Health and Wealth" doctrine that is so prevalent with tele-evangelists today. Does the Bible really teach that we'll be prosperous and healthy if we serve God?

item.title: Habits of Effective Christians (September 6, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed traits that we should have in our lives that will cause us to be effective Christians. We also examined traits that we should remove from our lives to increase our effectiveness.

item.title: What Happened to Our Free-time? (August 30, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we looked at a recent study that shows that we actually have more free-time than we did a few years ago. Yet, it seems like we never have enough time in our schedules especially when it comes to serving God.

item.title: God's Plan for Our Happiness (August 23, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed God's instructions for us and how they benefit us in our lives. God's instructions for us are for our good and we discussed some of these instructions in this edition of the Virtual Bible Study.

item.title: What Contemporary Worship/Hand-Clapping? (August 16, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed contemporary worship and hand-clapping. What does the Bible teach about our worship? Is contemporary worship pleasing to God? What does the Bible say about hand-clapping?

item.title: Why Should We Study the Bible and How We Should Do It (August 9, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Bible study. Since the Bible is the inspired Word of God, we need to know about it's truth and we need to study it in a way that we can understand it. Be sure to listen to this important discussion.

item.title: What About Women Preachers? (August 2, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed women preachers. What does the Bible say about women preaching or being in positions of authority?

item.title: The Sins of the Tongue (July 26, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the sins of the tongue. We looked at aspects of how we use our tongues and some sins of the tongue that are often overlooked.

item.title: The Christian and Summer Recreation (July 19, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the decisions we make for our summer time recreational activities. Many temptations present themselves to us in our summer time recreational persuits and we discussed them on this edition of the Virtual Bible Study.

item.title: The Old Testament (July 12, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the Old Testament. What are the characteristics of the Old Testament that show us that it is inspired of God? What do we learn from the Old Testament and how does it help us today?

item.title: Problems Facing Young People Today (July 5, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the problems facing young people today. From peer-pressure to the internet, we looked at temptations facing young people today and ways they can overcome the temptations.

item.title: Repentance (June 28, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed repentance. The Bible teaches us that repentance is required in order to be pleasing to God. What does repentance involve?

item.title: Baptism (June 21, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed baptism. Is baptism required for salvation? What does the Bible say about this important subject?

item.title: Lies Satan Wants You to Believe (June 14, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we examined lies that Satan uses to try and cause us to sin. Satan is a liar and he wants us to fall. What are some lies that we need to be aware of that he uses?

item.title: Church Discipline (June 7, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed church discipline. What is it? How and why is it to be done? What about withdrawing from those who have already "left the church"?

item.title: Biblical Principles of Parenting (May 31, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed parenting and what the Bible teaches about the subject. What does the Bible teach about discipline? How should we be raising our children?

item.title: Marriage, Divorce, and Remarriage (May 24, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed marriage divorce and remarriage. What are God's instructions about this important subject? What are some false docrines relating to this subject?

item.title: Miscellaneous Bible Questions (May 17, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed various Bible questions. What does the Bible say about Heaven and Hell? What does the Bible say about praying to Jesus? What about near death experiences?

item.title: What About Latter Day Revelations? (May 10, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed latter day revelations. Kenneth G, a self-professed prophet, joined us to discuss how he believes that he received special information from God. How do we know if a revelation is from God?

item.title: Legalism (May 03, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we studied legalism. What makes someone a "Legalist"? What are the characteristics of legalism and should they be avoided?

item.title: Who Would Crucify Christ Today? (April 26, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we considered the question that if Christ were alive today, who would want to crucify him? Would it be the "religious" people or the non-religious people? It was the "religious" people who wanted Christ crucified. It stands to reason that if we possessed the same characteristics today that we would want him to be crucified as well!

item.title: Modesty (April 19, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed modesty. What guidelines should we use in deciding what clothes we should wear? What do our clothes say about us, our heart, and our desire to be pleasing to God?

item.title: What About Dancing? (April 12, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed dancing? Can a Christian dance? Is it appropriate for a Christian to attend the Prom? What does the Bible say? We investigate it on this edition of the Virtual Bible Study!

item.title: An Investigation of Islam (April 5, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Islam with Andrew Roberts. What does the Muslim religion teach? How does it compare to what the Bible teaches? Be sure to listen to this informative discussion!

item.title: Why Do I Want to Be a Disciple of Christ? (March 29, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed reasons why we would want to suffer the persecutions that are required to be a disciple of Christ? Why do we go to the effort to be pleasing to God? What benefits do we enjoy as a result of serving God?

item.title: Discussion of Television Immorality with Tennesse State Senator (March 22, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study Tennessee State Senator Doug Jackson joined us to discuss his new bill that has been called the "Girls Gone Wild Bill". What should be our reaction to immorality on television? What can we do to support legislation that limits immorality on television? You need to hear this important discussion with Senator Jackson!

item.title: Evidences for the Resurrection (March 15, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed the recent documentary on the Discovery Channel entitled "The Lost Tomb of Jesus" in which it is claimed that the bones of Christ have been discovered. What are the evidences of the Resurrection? How can we have confidence that Christ did resurrect from the dead?

item.title: Addiction to Pornography (March 08, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed homosexuality. What does the Bible say about pornography? How can we keep from falling prey to this sin that is becoming more and more prominent in our society? You won't want to miss this important discussion!

item.title: Discussion with an Ex-Jehovah's Witness (March 01, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we interviewed an ex-Jehovah's Witness to find out why she left that group. We discussed the Jehovah's Witnesses false doctrines and also suggested topics of discussion when studying with Jehovah's Witnesses.

item.title: What the Bible Teaches about Astrology and Angels (February 22, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Astrology and Angels. What does the Bible teach about these popular subjects?

item.title: The Christian's View of Work (February 15, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed work and the Christian's view of it. What does the Bible teach us about our work? How should we view our jobs? Why should we work?

item.title: Evidences for the Existence of God (February 8, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed evidences for the existence of God. The world that we live in demands that there must be a God by the evidence that it displays. What is that evidence? We examined some of it on this edition of the Virtual Bible Study.

item.title: Discussion with an Atheist (February 1, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed Atheism with Josh who is an Atheist. We discussed why he does not believe in God. We discussed some of his views about how we got here, why we're here, and what we have to hope for when we die.

item.title: Review of Shirley Phelps-Roper Interview (January 25, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we reviewed our interview with Shirley Phelps-Roper. Her views are Calvinistic and directly contradict the teachings of the Bible. What does the Bible say about Homosexuals and other sinners? Did God make them this way?

item.title: Shirley Phelps-Roper Interview (January 18, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we inteviewed Shirley Phelps-Roper from the Westboro Baptist Church and discussed that group's outrageous activities and views. We discovered that the Westboro Baptist Church's activites are based upon a Calvinistic view of the Bible. You won't want to miss this revealing discussion with Mrs. Phelps-Roper!

item.title: Membership in a Local Church (January 11, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed our membership in a local congregation. Are we required to be a member of a local congregation to be pleasing to God? In what was can we leave a congregation? What about church discipline of or withdrawing from an unfaithful Christian?

item.title: Forgiving as God has Forgiven Us (January 04, 2007)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed forgiveness. God has instructed us that if we do not forgive others, He will not forgive us. How should we forgive? What are some attitudes that we should possess as we forgive? What about forgiving others who do not ask for our forgiveness?

item.title: Reviewing and Renewing our Spiritual Goals (December 28, 2006)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed areas that we can focus on in the coming year to ensure that we grow spiritually. What are some priorities that we can set to encourage spiritual growth? What are some things that we can do differently in the coming year to become stronger?

item.title: Christmas Dangers (December 21, 2006)
item.description: In this edition of The Virtual Bible Study we discussed some of the temptations that Satan presents to us during the holiday season. Is it acceptable to tell our children that Santa Claus is real? Is it acceptable to drink alcohol at a Christmas party? Is materialism a problem th be on guard against during the holidays? These are some of the issues that we discussed on this program.
